CatDescriptText: Fred Miller, construction worker, Fifth Ward, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 18, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "If you were granted an audience with Nikita Khrushchev, what would you say to him?" answer reads: "I would try to convince him that the atomic tests are more destructive to humanity than anything else in the world today."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Fred Miller wearing moustache, cap, striped shirt, and dark zippered jacket, standing in front of car and truck
